column2: Paty07, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So i have been on this BC for only a month 1/2. i have been on Ortho Tri Low and Yazmin! I LOVED Yazmin. This one not so much. i've noticed that i've been breaking out more now i never broke out i would have a pimple here and there every 6 months and now it seems i have a new pimple everyday. I have also noticed that i crave everything im not a chocolate person and now i was chocolate all the time i crave sweets i eat all the time and im gaining weight. With the other to pills i lost weight 20lbs with Yazmin. Most importantly i've notice im losing my sex drive. i dont want to have sex anymore with my bf. and before we had a very healthy sex life. I thinking of switching. please let me know if any of your girls are going through the same!

column2: ....., 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After trying struggling to find a birth control pill that worked for me (previous pills causes acne, mood swings, etc) I was put on this pill - and it worked - all my previous symptoms stopped, and my period became lighter, and only lasted 2-3 days, as compared to 6-8 days long before. Unexpectedly, I became pregnant while on the pill. My husband and I were excited, but surprised. I'm guessing that the pill just isn't for me and I'm going to need to switch to something like an IUD after our second child is born. :) Besides

column2: CamL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At the time I tried the orthonovum, I had taken ortho-tricyclen for many years, but continued to have my period for 6-7 days. I tried Ortho novum to attempt to reduce menstruation days.  Unfortunately, I had one of the serious and rare reactions, in that I began to have severe mood swings precipitated by rather benign events.  On one occassion, I became enraged that a particular street sign was not marked well, and I could not find my destination.  I flew into such a rage, that I thought if I crashed my car into a telephone pole, maybe they would mark the street better.  Obviously, mood swings that foster impulsive suicidal thoughts is not a good thing.  Fortunately, once I calmed down, I recognized that my recent mood instability correlated with beginning the new medication.  I immediately discontinued the medication, and returned to my baseline fairly quickly, which is typically very stable and euthymic.  This event happened to me years ago, while in graduate school training to become a Mental health clinician.  Luckily, I had enough understanding about the effects of medications that I was able to recognize the relationship between my mood instablity and the ortho novum. I was able to discontinue it after a short period of time and was able to avoid serious compications that the medication could have caused.  I do know now that I am fairly sensitive to hormonal shifts, and may have been more predisposed biochemically to have such a reaction to this medication.  Please consult with your MD before taking this medication if you already know if you are particularly sensitive to hormones, as it could potentially cause a lot of serious problems.

column2: faith17, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've gone through 4 different types of birth control until I found the one that didn't cause mood swings,nausea, or light sensitivity. And this particular one worked perfectly for me - no problems, no issues. But every person is different and sometimes one has to try several different kinds to find the one.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take this purely for my PCOS. I started this when I was also starting another drug (commonly used for Diabetes), Metformin. When I first start the cycle, I tend to get a little nauseous. Some random days, my night is so filled with nausea that I do throw up. It's a bit of a deterrent to taking it. I never got a period - and I was ok with that; still don't know why I need one - and when I first had one caused by the pill, it was MURDER. I remember not knowing what to do; the pads were uncomfortable - I don't use tampons, even now. I remember I had to silently suffer through a cramp that lasted for 5 minutes straight. But still, I'd tried others, and they made me moody, so I still stick with it.
